intro: Fimbristylis pentaptera, commonly known as the five-lobed sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are often pale green to reddish in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. Fimbristylis pentaptera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
